tables.name: ISemanticColors
tables.descriptionHtml:
The collection of all semantic slots for colors used in themes.

Note: text colors are defined in ISemanticTextColors.ts.

## Naming Convention

The name of a semantic slot can quickly tell you how it’s meant to be used. It generally follows this format:

[category name][element name][checked state][hovered/pressed/disabled state] [category name] – The “family” that this slot belongs to. [element name] – The name of the thing being targeted, such as the background or border. [checked state] – Whether the thing is checked. We assume things are unchecked by default, so no need to specify the unchecked state. (We used “checked” to refer to anything that is on, selected, toggled, highlighted, emphasized, etc.) [hovered/pressed/disabled state] – One of these states, if applicable. Each of these states are mutually exclusive. Pressed styles overwrite hovered styles, and disabled elements cannot be hovered or pressed.

## Base Slots

A basic set of slots that provide many default body styles, such as text, subtext, disabled colors, and so on. If a category doesn't provide the slot you're looking for, use one from this category. For example, the placeholder text on a text input field has no corresponding slot in its category, so you'd use the bodySubtextColor from this category.

## Invariants

When color has meaning, we do not want to change the color much theme to theme. For example, we will always want errors to be some shade of red, but we will need to tweak the exact shade so it's legible depending on whether it's an inverted theme or not. Invariant colors should almost never be changed by the theme, the defaults should suffice.

## Input Controls

This category contains input components commonly used to denote state, including radio buttons, check boxes, toggle switches, sliders, progress bars, and more.

## Buttons

Buttons! And all the flavors thereof.

## Menus

Any kind of popup menus uses this category.

## Lists

Lists differ from menus in that they are designed to show infinite amounts of items, often scroll, and have a large and complex interaction surface. This category covers all kinds of lists, whether they're typical one-item-per-row lists (like DetailsList) or ones with a tiled layout.

members.name: accentButtonBackground
members.descriptionHtml: Background of an accent button (kicker)

members.name: blockingBackground
members.descriptionHtml: Background for blocking issues, which is more severe than a warning, but not as bad as an error.

members.name: bodyBackground
members.descriptionHtml: The default color for backgrounds.

members.name: bodyDivider
members.descriptionHtml: Divider lines; e.g. lines that separate sections in a menu, an <HR> element.

members.name: bodyFrameBackground
members.descriptionHtml: The color for chrome adjacent to an area with bodyBackground. This can be used to provide visual separation of zones when using stronger colors, when using a divider line is not desired. In most themes, this should match the color of bodyBackground. See also: bodyFrameDivider

members.name: bodyFrameDivider
members.descriptionHtml: Used as the border between a zone with bodyFrameBackground and a zone with bodyBackground. If bodyBackground and bodyFrameBackground are different, this should be the same color as bodyFrameBackground in order to visually disappear. See also: bodyFrameBackground

members.name: bodyStandoutBackground
members.descriptionHtml: The standout color for highlighted content backgrounds. For highlighted content when there is no emphasis, use the neutral variant instead. This should be a shade darker than bodyBackground in light themes, and a shade lighter in inverted themes.

members.name: buttonBackground
members.descriptionHtml: Background of a standard button

members.name: buttonBackgroundChecked
members.descriptionHtml: Background of a checked standard button; e.g. bold/italicize/underline text button in toolbar

members.name: buttonBackgroundCheckedHovered
members.descriptionHtml: Background of a checked and hovered standard button; e.g. bold/italicize/underline text button in toolbar

members.name: buttonBackgroundDisabled
members.descriptionHtml: Background of a disabled standard button

members.name: buttonBackgroundHovered
members.descriptionHtml: Background of a hovered standard button

members.name: buttonBackgroundPressed
members.descriptionHtml: Background of a pressed standard button; i.e. currently being clicked by mouse

members.name: buttonBorder
members.descriptionHtml: Border of a standard button

members.name: buttonBorderDisabled
members.descriptionHtml: Border of a disabled standard button

members.name: defaultStateBackground
members.descriptionHtml: Background color for default/empty state graphical elements; eg default icons, empty section that needs user to fill in content, placeholder graphics, empty seats, etc.

members.name: disabledBackground
members.descriptionHtml: The default color for backgrounds of disabled controls; e.g. disabled text field.

members.name: errorBackground
members.descriptionHtml: The background for errors, if necessary, or highlighting the section of the page where the error is present.

members.name: focusBorder
members.descriptionHtml: The color of the outline around focused controls that don't already have a border; e.g. menu items

members.name: inputBackground
members.descriptionHtml: The background color of an input, e.g. textbox background.

members.name: inputBackgroundChecked
members.descriptionHtml: The background of a checked control; e.g. checked radio button's dot, checked toggle's background.

members.name: inputBackgroundCheckedHovered
members.descriptionHtml: The background of a checked and hovered control; e.g. checked checkbox's background color on hover.

members.name: inputBorder
members.descriptionHtml: The border of a large input control in its resting, state; e.g. the box of dropdown.

members.name: inputBorderHovered
members.descriptionHtml: The border color of a large hovered input control, such as textbox.

members.name: inputFocusBorderAlt
members.descriptionHtml: The alternate focus border color for elements that already have a border; e.g. text field borders on focus.

members.name: inputForegroundChecked
members.descriptionHtml: The foreground of a checked control; e.g. checked checkbox's checkmark color, checked toggle's thumb color, radio button's background color around the dot.

members.name: listBackground
members.descriptionHtml: The background color for the entire list.

members.name: listHeaderBackgroundHovered
members.descriptionHtml: The background color for a hovered list header.

members.name: listHeaderBackgroundPressed
members.descriptionHtml: The background color for a pressed list header.

members.name: listItemBackgroundChecked
members.descriptionHtml: The background color of a checked list item.

members.name: listItemBackgroundCheckedHovered
members.descriptionHtml: The background color of a checked and hovered list item.

members.name: listItemBackgroundHovered
members.descriptionHtml: The background color of a hovered list item.

members.name: listText
members.descriptionHtml: The default text color for list item titles and text in column fields.

members.name: menuBackground
members.descriptionHtml: The background of a menu.

members.name: menuDivider
members.descriptionHtml: The divider between menu items.

members.name: menuHeader
members.descriptionHtml: The headers in menus that denote title of a section.

members.name: menuIcon
members.descriptionHtml: The default colors of icons in menus.

members.name: menuItemBackgroundHovered
members.descriptionHtml: The background of a hovered menu item.

members.name: menuItemBackgroundPressed
members.descriptionHtml: The background of a pressed menu item.

members.name: menuItemText
members.descriptionHtml: The text color of a menu item.

members.name: menuItemTextHovered
members.descriptionHtml: The text color of a hovered menu item.

members.name: primaryButtonBackground
members.descriptionHtml: Background of a primary button

members.name: primaryButtonBackgroundDisabled
members.descriptionHtml: Background of a disabled primary button

members.name: primaryButtonBackgroundHovered
members.descriptionHtml: Background of a hovered primary button

members.name: primaryButtonBackgroundPressed
members.descriptionHtml: Background of a pressed primary button; i.e. currently being clicked by mouse

members.name: primaryButtonBorder
members.descriptionHtml: Border of a primary button

members.name: smallInputBorder
members.descriptionHtml: The border of a small input control in its resting unchecked state; e.g. the box of an unchecked checkbox.

members.name: successBackground
members.descriptionHtml: Background for success

members.name: variantBorder
members.descriptionHtml: The color of the border that provides contrast between an element, such as a card, and an emphasized background.

members.name: variantBorderHovered
members.descriptionHtml: Hover color of border that provides contrast between an element, such as a card, and an emphasized background.

members.name: warningBackground
members.descriptionHtml: Background for warning messages.

members.name: warningHighlight
members.descriptionHtml: Foreground color for warning highlights
